intro_quote: “I don’t need a lot… all I need is a top-book.”
intro_lead: This saying best explains my time consuming book procurement, administration and reading process and my disruptive reading technique which enables me to read every free minute and to select only pageturners out of a big variety of books. A dream!!
note_html:
Everything is based on a database which is connected to my physical bookshelf.
More about how and why I did this is explained in About me.

home_hero_title: Turn waiting time in reading time.
home_hero_lede: PagesInLine is a paperbook-based method to support a relaxed readingexperience. Pocket sections, real-life minutes, visible progress. No smartphone reading. No e-reader. Just pages.
home_bullet_1: Always with you: pocket sections, not a heavy book.
home_bullet_2: Read in real life: station, queue, checkout.
home_bullet_4: Read what you love—drop what you don’t.
home_how_1: Pick a paperback you want to read.
home_how_2: Split it into pocket sections (20–40 pages).
home_how_3: Carry one section and read top-to-bottom.
home_how_4: Use micro-moments (waiting time becomes reading time).
home_how_5: Done pages → recycling (you always know where you stopped).
home_start_lede: Choose one book you actually want. Make one small section. Read every waiting minute today.

info.technik.title: bookswiping, a gamechanger
info.technik.p1: Swiping on a smartphone means changing content when you’ve seen enough or don’t like it.
info.technik.p2: With paperbooks that seemed impossible—until I had the idea to cut my books into small pieces.
info.technik.p3: A new world opened up: pages are always close when a reading moment comes up (supermarket line, check‑in, train, plane…).
info.technik.p4: I can carry several book parts and switch if a book isn’t a pageturner. Read pages go to the bin, so I always know where I stopped.
info.ausruestung.title: My equipment
info.ausruestung.p1: A few things make the 3R reading routine easy in everyday life.
info.ausruestung.p_markers: Once the cover is removed I still want to know which book I’m reading. I register books in Google Sheets, add barcodes, and use different colors to recognize them quickly on the shelf.
info.ausruestung.p_ducktape: To secure loose pages I use tape. It keeps everything in the right place.
info.ausruestung.p_bookshelf: The bookshelf is the center of my reading strategy: organized, dry, safe—and ready when I want to pick the next book.
info.ausruestung.p_bag: When traveling I use a reading bag to store books. It’s easier than a backpack for quick access—and even works as a trash bag for finished pages.
info.beschaffung.title: How do I get pageturners?
info.beschaffung.p1: I usually buy my books at flea markets.
info.beschaffung.p2: For new books I go to Hugendubel in Munich (Karlsplatz) to test‑read and decide—also available online.
info.beschaffung.p3: For used books in Munich I recommend Antiquariat Angelika Ziegler, Landsberger Str. 71, 80339 Munich (also online).
info.faq.title: Questions you might have
info.faq.q1: How long have you been doing this already?
info.faq.q2: Don’t you miss the books that are gone?
info.faq.a2: For me reading is a process that happens now. If I miss a book I can buy it again—there are too many books to miss any.
info.faq.q3: Do you remember the books you have read?
info.faq.a3: The great ones yes. A real pageturner is hard to forget.
info.faq.a4: Three reasons: (1) bigger choice—especially older paperbacks, (2) I love the haptic of paperbooks, (3) pages fit in any pocket (and you can even sit on them).
info.about.title: What drives me to use a reading technique?
info.about.lede: How the 3R technique helped me return to reading—more often, with better books.
info.about.p1: As a kid, I devoured adventure stories—especially Karl May. Later, life got busy and reading slowly slipped away.
info.about.p2: One day I discovered the 3R technique, and it brought books back into my daily routine. Suddenly even small breaks became reading time.
info.about.p3: What I love most: the 3R technique helps me find truly good books faster. I can always keep a few options with me—so I’m never stuck without something worth reading.
info.about.p4: Today I’m grateful for how many great books I’ve discovered this way—and I’m excited for the next ones.
